intro: Simaba laevis, commonly known as the smooth simaba, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal areas and wetlands. The fruit is a capsule that releases small, hairy seeds when mature.
